page.title: 11HOUSING
page.content: There are 1494 houses in Birtley privately owned and 1457 houses rented by the council. Some houses are let privately. There is a higher than average council housing sector but overcrowding and houses lacking basic amenities are fairly typical. Over 47O pensioners live alone, 26 of these live in houses which do not have their own bathroom or inside toilet.Over one third of the houses in Birtley contain at least one pensioner. 481 live in council property 167 own homes. Older houses in Birtley need improving but the council say they do not have enough money to do this. The newest are at Fell Bank, these are privately built. A new council estate is planned for Northside with 1,OOO houses.
